list.help: You may provide one or more filters like 'filter:value'

console.banner:
Command Line Interface for the Nexcess.net / Thermo.io API Client
ⓒ 2018 Nexcess.net, LLC

list.desc: List all backups for a given cloud account.
list.help: Outputs a list of all the backups for a given cloud account

delete.help: Delete a specific backup from the system

create.backup_complete:
Backup complete.
<info>To download this backup, use:</info>
cloud-account:backup:download --cloud-account-id {cloud_account_id} \
  --filename '{filename}'
create.backup_started:
<info>To check on the status of this Backup, use:</info>
cloud-account:backup:show --cloud-account-id {cloud_account_id} \
  --filename '{filename}'
create.desc: Create a new backup for a given cloud account
create.help: Creates a new backup for a cloud account and optionally downloads it when complete. The given download path must exist and be writable.
create.opt_download: Local filesystem path to download backup to

create.arg_app: Application Environment name (used for app_id lookup)
create.ask_domain: What Domain Name do you want to use for your Cloud Account?
create.choose_app_id: Select an Application Environment for your Cloud Account:
create.choose_cloud_id: Choose which Cloud you want your Cloud Account to be hosted on:
create.choose_package_id: Choose a Service Level for your Cloud Account:
create.created: Your new Cloud Account has been created. <info>Use</info> cloud-account:show {id} <info>to check on its status!</info>
create.creating: Your new Cloud Account is being created. <info>This may take a few moments…</info>
create.failed: <error>Creating your new Cloud Account failed.</error> Please open a support ticket.
create.help:
Any option may be omitted and you will be prompted to choose from a menu.
Providing an application name (e.g., 'magento') will select that application for you.
create.opt_install_app:
Install the Application to the new Cloud Account?
  (currently, this option applies only to Magento and WordPress Application Environments)
create.timed_out: <comment>Wait timeout exceeded:</comment> your new Cloud Account is still being set up. <info>Use</info> cloud-account:show {id} <info>to check on its status.</info>

list.help: You may proivde one or more filters in the form 'filter:value'.

show.choose_id: Select a Cloud Account to view:
show.desc: Shows details of an existing Cloud Account
show.help: Provide a service id, or use the --domain or --ip options to look up the desired service.
show.opt_domain: Cloud Account Domain Name (used for service_id lookup)
show.opt_ip: Cloud Account IP Address (used for service_id lookup)

command.invalid_list_filter: List filters must be in the format 'property:value'; '{filter}' is invalid
command.missing_input:
Missing or invalid input for '{name}';
 see $ nexcess-cli {command} --help
command.no_lookup_match:
'{lookup}' does not match any {input}; please choose one of:
 {choices}

exception.invalid_config_type: SDK configuration class must extend from Nexcess\Sdk\Util\Config; {type} specified
exception.profile_not_found: Could not find profile '{profile}' in current directory or any parent directory
exception.unsupported_profile_type: user profile format must be one of {supported}; '{type}' is not a supported

console.opt_api_token: Your API Token (log in to your portal to create one)
console.opt_json: Display command output as json? (this does not affect interactive output; see --no-interaction)
console.opt_language: Specify preferred language (currently, only en_US is supported)
console.opt_profile: Filename of the user profile to load; or one of nexcess|thermo to use the default profiles
console.opt_sandboxed: Do not send any API requests
console.opt_wait: Wait for long-running commands to complete (this can block for a long time)?
